chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: This section describes how to install HornetQ.

section.title: Prerequisites

note.para: HornetQ only runs on Java 5 or later. We highly recommend to use Java 6.

section.para: By default, HornetQ server is run with 1GiB of memory. If your computer has less memory, or you want to run it with more available RAM, modify the value in bin/run.sh accordingly.

For persistence, HornetQ uses its own fast journal, which you can configure to use libaio (which is the default when running on Linux) or Java NIO. In order to use the libaio module on Linux, it's required to install libaio.
If you're not running on Linux then you don't need to worry about this.

section.title: Standalone HornetQ Server
section.para: After downloading the distribution, unzip it into your chosen directory. At this point it should be possible to run straight out of the box, the following describes the directory structure:
section.programlisting: |-- bin |-- config | |-- jboss-as | `-- stand-alone |-- docs | |-- api | |-- quickstart-guide | `-- user-manual |-- examples | |-- core | |-- javaee | `-- jms |-- lib |-- licenses `-- schemas

listitem.para: bin -- binaries and scripts needed to run JBoss Messaging

config -- configuration files needed to configure HornetQ. This contains configurations to run HornetQ either in stand-alone or inside JBoss AS 5. Please refer to the reference guide for details on configuration.
docs -- guides and javadocs for HornetQ
examples -- JMS and Java EE examples. Please refer to the 'running examples' chapter for details on how to run them.
lib -- jars and libraries needed to run HornetQ
schemas -- XML Schemas used to validate HornetQ configuration files

section.title: HornetQ In JBoss AS 5
section.para: HornetQ can be deployed in JBoss AS 5. It is not shipped by default with the application server and you need to create new AS 5 profiles to run AS 5 with HornetQ.

listitem.para: Set the environment property JBOSS_HOME to point to the directory where you installed JBoss AS 5
run ./build.sh (or build.bat if you are on Windows) in HornetQ's config/jboss-as directory

section.para: This will create 2 new profiles in $JBOSS_HOME/server:

listitem.para: default-with-hornetq -- it corresponds to AS 5 default profile with HornetQ as its JMS provider. In this profile, HornetQ is non-clustered
all-with-hornetq -- it corresponds to AS 5 all profile with HornetQ as its JMS provider. In this profile, HornetQ is clustered

section.para: You can then start JBoss AS 5 using one of these profiles:

section.title: HornetQ In JBoss AS 4

note.para: HornetQ can be deployed on AS 4 but isn't recommended

section.para: As in AS 4, it is not shipped by default with the application server and you need to create new AS 4 profiles to run AS 4 with HornetQ.

listitem.para: Set the environment property JBOSS_HOME to point to the directory where you installed JBoss AS 4
run ./build.sh (or build.bat if you are on Windows) as4 in HornetQ's config/jboss-as directory
